DimensionalModule#

class DimensionalModule(*constraints: tuple[int, int])[source]#

Bases: Module

Module with support for dimensionally constrained buffers and parameters.

Parameters:

constraints (tuple[int, int]) – tuple of (dim, size) dimensional constraints for constrained buffers and parameters.

Raises:

  • ValueError – constraints must specify a positive number of elements.

  • RuntimeError – no two constraints may share a dimension.

Note

Each argument must be a 2-tuple of integers, where the first element is the dimension to which a constraint is applied and the second is the size of that dimension. Dimensions can be negative.

Important

Constraints are not checked on every assignment and as such may be invalidated. This can be tested with reconstrain().

compatible(value: Tensor) → bool[source]#

Test if a tensor is compatible with the module’s constraints.

Parameters:

value (torch.Tensor) – tensor to test.

Returns:

if the tensor is compatible.

Return type:

bool

classmethod compatible_(value: Tensor, constraints: dict[int, int]) → bool[source]#

Test if a tensor is compatible with a set of constraints.

Parameters:

  • value (torch.Tensor) – tensor to test.

  • constraints (dict[int, int]) – constraint dictionary to test with.

Returns:

if the tensor is compatible.

Return type:

bool

compatible_like(shape: tuple[int]) → tuple[int][source]#

Generates a shape like the input, but compatible with the constraints.

Parameters:

  • shape (tuple[int]) – shape to make compatible

  • constraints (dict[int, int] | None, optional) – constraint dictionary to test with, uses current constraints if None. Defaults to None.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – dimensionality of shape is insufficient.

  • RuntimeError – constraints contains nonpositive sized dimensions.

Returns:

compatiblized shape.

Return type:

tuple[int]

classmethod compatible_like_(shape: tuple[int], constraints: dict[int, int]) → tuple[int][source]#

Generates a shape like the input, but compatible with the constraints.

Parameters:

  • shape (tuple[int]) – shape to make compatible

  • constraints (dict[int, int]) – constraint dictionary to test against.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – dimensionality of shape is insufficient.

  • RuntimeError – constraints contains nonpositive sized dimensions.

Returns:

compatiblized shape.

Return type:

tuple[int]

property constraints: dict[int, int]#

Returns the constraint dictionary, sorted by dimension.

Returns:

active constraints, represented as a dictionary.

Return type:

dict[int, int]

Note

The results will be sorted by dimension, from low to high. Therefore, positive dimensions are presented first, in increasing order, then negative dimensions also in increasing order.

property constraints_repr: str#

Returns a string representation of constraints.

Returns:

active constraints, represented as a string.

Return type:

str

Note

Like with constraints(), dimensions are sorted from low to high. Underscores represent dimensions which must be present in the constrained tensor but with an unspecified value.

deregister_constrained(name: str)[source]#

Deregisters a buffer or parameter as constrained.

Parameters:

name (str) – fully-qualified string name of the buffer or parameter to register.

property mindims: int#

Minimum number of constrained dimensions for constrained tensor.

Returns:

minimum required number of dimensions.

Return type:

int

static mindims_(constraints: dict[int, int]) → int[source]#

Computes minimum number of required dimensions for a constrained tensor.

Parameters:

constraints (dict[int, int]) – constraint dictionary of (dim, size).

Returns:

minimum required number of dimensions.

Return type:

int

reconstrain(dim: int | None, size: int | None) → None[source]#

Edits existing constraints and reshapes constrained buffers and parameters accordingly.

Parameters:

  • dim (int | None) – dimension to which a constraint should be added, removed, or modified, or if None, only existing constraints are tested.

  • size (int | None) – size of the new constraint, or None if the constraint should be removed.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – constrained buffer or parameter had its shape modified externally and is no longer compatible.

  • ValueError – size must specify a positive number of elements.

  • ValueError – added constraint is incompatible with existing buffer or parameter.

register_constrained(name: str)[source]#

Registers an existing buffer or parameter as constrained.

Parameters:

name (str) – fully-qualified string name of the buffer or parameter to register.

Raises:

  • RuntimeError – dimension of attribute does not match constraint.

  • AttributeError – attribute is not a registered buffer or parameter.

Note

Registered parameters of type None cannot be constrained.
